description: The full title of the research product and its abbreviations or aliases.
Brief text that describes the research product; its content and features.
The creator of the research product. It could be a single person; a group of people; an organization; etc.
Person or organization that has contributed to the realization of the research product.
The publisher of the research product; e.g. the University hosting the research product.
The type of research product.
An identifier of the research product; e.g. a DOI; ISBN or ISSN code.
The date or year the research product was released.
The language(s) used in/by the research product.
The format in which the data is released.
range Restriction: EU Vocabularies - File Type | IANA Media Types

description: Metadata standards that the research product conforms to.
The status of a research product in its lifecycle.
A research product that is part of the current one
A research product that the current one is part of.

The academic field(s) the research product pertains to. If possible; use the id and/or name of the official classification (we reccomend italian scholars to use the 'Gruppo Scientifico Disciplinare' established by CUN).
Research activities afforded by the research product.
Research activities performed to realise the research product.
The URL of the downloadable files; if available; or the URL of the download page.
The current version of the research product.
The website where the research product is presented.
Bibliographic references to publications that describe or review the research product. The curator should insert the URL to the publication.
The research project the resarch product belongs to.
The software component used to realise the research product; e.g. another research products.
The data service (API; endpoint) or website that grants access to the research product.
The URL of the documentation of the research product.
How the resource can be accessed. If more access rights are in place; describe how the main resource should be accessed here; and use 'Has part' to describe a subset for which different rights apply.
The license under which the research product is available to the public.
The cataloguing record of the edited work (from the Open Library). If no records exists; enter 'Last name; name (year). Title'.
The URL of a web resource presenting the edited source (e.g. digital manuscript; cataloguing record in other sources than the Open Library).
The bibliographic or archival reference of the edited text.
range Restriction: label associated to the reference above

description: Provide additional information on the edited text; e.g. if the source is an original manuscript or an edition.
The author of the edited text. If the edition is 'document-centric' it is possible to indicate the hand(s).
The type of the edited text.
range Restriction: atlas:collectedWork ; atlas:collectionOfTexts; atlas:paper; altas:serialDocument; atlas:letter; atlas:diary; atlas:charter; atlas:inscription.

description: The genre of the edited text. Specify both general terms like 'prose' or 'poetry' and specific values like 'picaresque novel' and 'sonnet'. if applicable.
The type of edition. It briefly indicates how the editorial team has worked on the text and what are the main goals of the edition.
range Restriction: atlas:best-manuscriptEdition ; atlas:criticalEdition ; atlas:digitalEdition ; atlas:diplomaticEdition ; atlas:documentaryEdition ; atlas:eclecticEdition ; atlas:monotypicEdition ; atlas:synopticEdition

description: The ontologies and vocabularies used to organise data.
The cataloguing record of the main edited works (from the Open Library). If no records exists; enter 'Last name; name (year). Title'.
The URL of a web resource presenting the main edited sources (e.g. digital manuscript; cataloguing record in other sources than the Open Library).
The bibliographic or archival reference of the edited text.
range Restriction: label associated to the reference above

description: Additional information on the edited text; e.g. if the source is an original manuscript or an edition.
The main author(s) of the edited text(s). If the edition is 'document-centric' it is possible to indicate the hand(s).
The type of the edited text.
range Restriction: atlas:collectedWork ; atlas:collectionOfTexts; atlas:paper; altas:serialDocument; atlas:letter; atlas:diary; atlas:charter; atlas:inscription.

description: The genre of the edited text. Specify both general terms like 'prose' or 'poetry' and specific values like 'picaresque novel' and 'sonnet'; if applicable.
The number of items collected and the unit of measurement; e.g. 500 documents; 230.000 tokens.
The namespace used by the terms of the ontology
Ontologies or vocabularies imported or partially reused by the current ontology.
The URL of the repository where the code of the software is stored (e.g. GitHub; Zenodo; FigShare).
If the software accepts data in input; add the format of data.
If the software produces data; add the format of output data.
The programming language used to develop the software
Software component that is reused/extended in the current software. It can be a research product or the URL of the official page of the software.
